Description:
The FHIR Observation.Create (Vitals) resource can file to all flowsheet rows, including vital signs. This resource can file vital signs for all flowsheets.

When a patient-facing app uses this API, it writes to patient-entered flowsheets. Before that can be done, a user in Epic must place an order to create the episode and patient entered flowsheets that will be filed to. Clinician or backend apps using this API will file to the same flowsheets that clinicians can document in.

An error is returned if a reading already exists. If an ID is included in the request, an error is returned. The server assigns an ID to the newly created resource.

This web service cannot write to closed encounters. Ensure that your app doesn't need to write to closed encounters before you begin development.
SampleRequest:
-----------------------------------------------

Strict Metadata in Component Element:

-----------------------------------------------

<Observation>

<category><coding><system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-category" /><code value="vital-signs" /><display value="Vital Signs" /></coding><text value="Vital Signs" /></category>

<code><coding><system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.707679" /><code value="2162" /><display value="After Lunch Glucose" /></coding><text value="After Lunch Glucose" /></code>

<subject><reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" /><display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr." /></subject>

<effectiveDateTime value="2017-08-04T17:42:00Z" />

<performer><reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" /><display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr." /></performer>

<valueQuantity><value value="6.3" /><unit value="mmol/L" /></valueQuantity>

<component>

<code>

<coding><system value="system=urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.708368"/><code value="2"/><display value="Blood Glucose Meal Time"/></coding>

</code>

<valueString value="2"/>

</component>

</Observation>

-----------------------------------------------

<component>

<coding><system value="system=urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.708368"/><code value="2"/><display value="Blood Glucose Meal Time"/></coding>

<code>

<coding><system value="system=urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.708368"/><code value="1"/><display value="UUID"/></coding>

</component>

</Observation>

-----------------------------------------------

<Observation>

<category><coding><system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-category" /><code value="vital-signs" /><display value="Vital Signs" /></coding><text value="Vital Signs" /></category>

<code><coding><system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.707679" /><code value="2162" /><display value="After Lunch Glucose" /></coding><text value="After Lunch Glucose" /></code>

<subject><reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" /><display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr." /></subject>

<effectiveDateTime value="2017-08-04T17:42:00Z" />

<performer><reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" /><display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr." /></performer>

<valueQuantity><value value="6.3" /><unit value="mmol/L" /></valueQuantity>

<component>

<code>

<text>"Long Metadata Key for Glucose Meal Time that was not defined beforehand"</text>

</code>

<valueString value="After meal"/>

</component>

</Observation>

category.Name: category
category.Description: This element supports only "vital-signs". If multiple category values are provided, they are filed if vital-signs is presented. The default is vital-signs.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The flowsheet (FLO) ID, encoded flowsheet ID, or LOINC codes to flowsheet mapping. What is being measured.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

comment.Name: comment
comment.Description: The comment. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

component.Name: component
component.Description: Only use this element if the observation is about blood pressure. Must provide both systolic and diastolic values. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
This element is used for observations filed by patients to patient-entered flowsheets.

Metadata related to the observation.

Represents strict metadata if the coding sub-element is populated. The following strict metadata are supported:

  • 1-UUID
    • The unique reading ID.
  • 2-Blood Glucose Meal Times
    • 1-Before meal
    • 2-After meal
  • 3-Insulin Delivery Reason
    • 1-Basal
    • 2-Bolus
Represents loose metadata if only the text sub-element is populated.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The encounter that this observation belongs to. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Who filed the observation. For the provider-facing context, the default is the signed-in user.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient FHIR ID for whom the observation is about. For the patient-facing context, the default is the user signed in.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: This element is populated if the data type is a custom list or category type.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: This element is populated if a value has units or the data type is numeric. Only one of value[x] is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description: This element is populated if a value doesn't have units or the data type is a string. Only one of value[x] is required.

valueTime.Name: valueTime
valueTime.Description: Use this element if data type is time. Only one of value[x] is required. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The flowsheet (FLO) ID, encoded flowsheet ID, or LOINC codes to flowsheet mapping. What is being measured.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

component.Name: component
component.Description: Populated only for blood pressure observation. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The encounter this observation belongs to. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description: The date and time the observation was taken.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description: The date and time the observation was documented. This is always the current time.

method.Name: method
method.Description: This is set to "Patient-entered" for PEF vital signs.

status.Name: status
status.Description: This element is always set to Final.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The FHIR ID for the patient the observation is about.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: This element is populated if the data type is category or custom list. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: This element is populated if data type date. Only one of value[x] is required. Applies only to the provider-facing context.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: This element is populated if a value has units or the data type is numeric. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description: This element is populated if a value doesn't have units or the data type is string. Only one of the value[x] elements is required.

valueTime.Name: valueTime
valueTime.Description: This element is populated if data type time. Only one of value[x] is required. Applies only to the provider-facing context.
